meanings.definition: A vertical structure typically dividing or enclosing an area.
meanings.sent1: The tall walls of the castle protected the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti on the walls of the school needed to be cleaned.
meanings.sent3: The walls of the maze seemed to be playing a trick on the adventurers.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed off the walls of the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The walls of the canyon rose high on either side, creating a breathtaking view.

meanings.definition: A side of a building or room.
meanings.sent1: The windows on the walls of the house let in plenty of sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She hung a painting on the wall of her bedroom.
meanings.sent3: The walls of the classroom listened to the teacher's every word.
meanings.sent4: The walls of the old church held many stories within their stones.
meanings.sent5: The walls of the cave were covered in ancient drawings.

meanings.definition: To enclose or shut off with walls.
meanings.sent1: They decided to walls off the garden to keep the rabbits out.
meanings.sent2: The king ordered to walls up the entrance to the secret chamber.
meanings.sent3: She walls off her heart after being hurt in the past.
meanings.sent4: The magician walls in the audience with a magical barrier.
meanings.sent5: The construction workers walls off the construction site for safety reasons.
